Frank, don't worry so much about it, we would  not even have this 
technolo=
gy to this point in time if not for you, anyway,  spirit still claim you wi=
ll 
be "the one to perfect it."  "Frank  Sumption will be the one to perfec=
t

n my 
pc, but it is here some place.  sf
 
 
In a message dated 11/8/2011 1=
2:01:30 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,  
purplealiengirl@... writes:

 
=
 
 
So, just to be clear, who in fact made "The Edison Box? You might see i=
n  
one of Hultay's latest posts, he pretty much claims he made it. 

I hav=
e  shared all I do, posted schematics everywhere on the web, and yet 
peopl=
e  accuse me of being negative, and the meanest bastard that ever lived 
wh=
en I  camplain about being lied about, ripped off, disrespected and 
insult=
ed.  

As far Edison---I don't care!! 

F-S

--- In _EVP-ITC@...=
m_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
"cfelton116" <cfelton@...> wrote:
>=

> 
> OK, I have to  chime in here.
> 
> A name is just a name. Because I p=
ut Edison on  the box has no bearing on 
whether or not he actually achieve=
d spirit  communications. The SB#3 was 
labeled Edison strictly for the per=
son that  wanted it. He said Edison helps 
and has helped him and there is =
no reason he  cannot have Edison on his box.
> 
> The fact is, it is a scan=
ning  radio to try to pick up the voices from 
spirits. Come on. bitching a=
bout a  name. Glad my name isn't Edison.
> 
> For you Frank, not a single  =
part of your circuit design went into SB#3. 
I did analyze your design and =
 found many flaws especially in the Random 
noise circuit. For that reason =
 alone, I could not use it. I am not trying to 
put you down in any way; yo=
u  were the one that brought radio scanning into 
the forefront.
> 
>  I ha=
ve been designing electronic circuits since I was 7yrs old. I am 41 
now. I=
  completely understand electronics and love to push the limits of 
physics=
 and  beyond. This radio sweep circuit is nothing. It is not complicated 
e=
lectronics  at all. Just do a few calculations to make sure you are 
amplif=
ying and  filtering correctly and build. I find this rather basic.
> 
> I a=
m  sorry you feel I took your box design by using wood. Maybe I will 
use a=
  different stain on the next one.
> 
> I will get some videos of  the diff=
erent modes of operation on the 
o-scope., just so you can see for  yoursel=
f, my circuit functions as I intended it 
too.
> 
> If you  would like, I c=
an markup your schematics so your random circuit 
will function  correctly.=
 You just need to remove and replace a component, 
and change a few  values=
. Your random circuit was off right from the very 
first component. How  ca=
n you possibly get a reliable low frequency random noise 
circuit without  =
using a known noise amount to begin with?
> 
> I am not hear to  bash anyon=
e, and I do not expect that myself. I am 
sorry you feel the way you  do Fr=
ank, but you are entitled to feel how ever you 
want. If you would like to =
 continue bashing, I can meet you blow for blow 
technically and I know I w=
ill  win.
> 
> Enough said. I will back up my circuit with  proof!
> 
> -Ch=
ris Felton
>  cfelton116@...
>
